title: Exchanging death talismans

properties.value: During and after Mourning's End Part II, Thorgel will request items from his item list, rewarding one death talisman per filled list.

Fastest routes to the Abyss.

During and after Mourning's End Part II, Thorgel will request items from his item list, rewarding one death talisman per filled list.

In order to get the most death talismans per hour, in a cost efficient way, start in Edgeville with law runes and 27 of the non-book items on the list and equip a dust battlestaff. Your player-owned house must have a bookcase built filled with the required books.

  1. Go into the Abyss
  2. Take the death rift to the Death Altar,
  3. Exit the altar through the portal and hand the items to Thorgel
  4. Teleport to House
  5. Take multiple of each of the books by using the drop trick: Crumbling tome, slashed book, battered book, and Prifddinas' history
  6. Teleport to Edgeville via amulet of glory, an ornate jewellery box, or fairy ring dkr
  7. Bank to withdraw new items

Beware of player-killers. The Mage of Zamorak is located in low-level Wilderness, near the source of the River Lum. This is a fairly safe area, but there may be player killers, so it is advised not to take any items other than those on the list on the trips to the Abyss.

Purchasing the tradeable items on the Grand Exchange may take days until every item is collected, so collecting a large amount of each item before attempting this is recommended. Beware of price volatity if you want to turn a higher profit!

The inner ring of the Abyss.
Due to constantly changing prices on the Grand Exchange, some information in this article may or may not be current.
It is strongly recommended to check the live prices on the Grand Exchange before making large investments in any method.
All prices on this page are cached, meaning it is possible that they appear out of date.
To force a new cache of this page, click this link.
If a money making method is out of date, you can edit it or leave a message on the talk page.

[[Mourning's End Part II]] |Details = [[File:Abyss Routes.png|right|thumb|175px|Fastest routes to the Abyss.]] During and after [[Mourning's End Part II]], [[Thorgel]] will request items from his [[item list]], rewarding one [[death talisman]] per filled list. In order to get the most death talismans per hour, in a cost efficient way, start in [[Edgeville]] with [[law rune]]s and 27 of the non-book items on the list and equip a [[dust battlestaff]]. Your [[player-owned house]] must have a [[Bookcase space|bookcase]] built filled with the required books. # Go into the [[Abyss]] # Take the [[death rift]] to the [[Death Altar]], # Exit the altar through the portal and hand the items to [[Thorgel]] # [[Teleport to House]] # Take multiple of each of the books by using the [[drop trick]]: [[Crumbling tome]], [[slashed book]], [[battered book]], and [[Prifddinas' history]] # Teleport to [[Edgeville]] via [[amulet of glory]], an [[ornate jewellery box]], or [[fairy ring]] {{Fairycode|dkr}} # [[Bank]] to withdraw new items '''Beware''' of player-killers. The [[Mage of Zamorak]] is located in low-level [[Wilderness]], near the source of the [[River Lum]]. This is a fairly safe area, but there may be [[player killer]]s, so it is advised not to take any items other than those on the list on the trips to the Abyss. Purchasing the tradeable items on the [[Grand Exchange]] may take days until every item is collected, so collecting a large amount of each item before attempting this is recommended. Beware of price volatity if you want to turn a higher profit! [[File:Inner ring of the Abyss.png|right|thumb|175px|The inner ring of the Abyss.]] }} {{Money making}}
